title: Bernoullis equation - pressure difference in tube

content.question: A fluid of density <math alttext="rho" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ρ</mi></math> is flowing with speed <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> through a horizontal tube of cross-sectional area <math alttext="A sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The tube splits into two smaller tubes, each at the same vertical height as the first tube. Each of the two smaller vessels has a cross-sectional area <math alttext="A sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, as shown in the top view figure. The pressure of the fluid in the regions where the cross-sectional areas are <math alttext="A sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="A sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> is <math alttext="P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="P sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following expressions is equal to the pressure difference <math alttext="P sub 2 minus P sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half rho v sub 1, end sub, squared, times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction with numerator A sub 1, end sub, squared, and denominator 4 A sub 2, end sub, squared, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>ρ</mi><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msup><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative fraction 15 over 2, end fraction, rho v sub 1, end sub, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mpadded><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>15</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mpadded><mi>ρ</mi><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative three halves, end fraction, rho v sub 1, end sub, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mpadded><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mpadded></mstyle><mpadded><mpadded><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>ρ</mi><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></mpadded></mpadded></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one half rho v sub 1, end sub, squared, times, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction with numerator A sub 1, end sub, squared, and denominator 4 A sub 2, end sub, squared, end fraction, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>ρ</mi><msup><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><msup><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
